str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Bodily, corporeal. From soma; corporeal or physical.
(physical) exercise, in a wide sense. From gumnazo; training, i.e. asceticism.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Puny; especially neuter somewhat.
Profitable, beneficial, useful. From a form of ophelos; helpful or serviceable, i.e. Advantageous.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Piety (towards God), godliness, devotion, godliness. From eusebes; piety; specially, the gospel scheme.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Profitable, beneficial, useful. From a form of ophelos; helpful or serviceable, i.e. Advantageous.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A promise. From epaggello; an announcement.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
